page.title: 04STREETS AND BUILDINGS-ii.
page.content:
ii. The manor House. The Manor House in High St. was recently bought for modernisation and was visited by a group of children.The building is of local ironstone and thatch.It dates from the sixteenth century.
"We entered a short passage and then the main living room.There used to be an old gas lamp a year ago which was so low that people kept bumping into it. There had been no electricity or running hot water.The previous owner had lived there alone until she was seventy and was used to living without such luxuries. In places ceilings are falling down and floors are unsafe because of the effect of Death Watch Beetle.In the oldest part wooden pegs hold the beams together instead of nails."
